title: 毕达哥拉斯定理
description: 毕达哥拉斯提出了著名的勾股定理，奠定了几何学基础
description_en: Pythagoras proposed the famous Pythagorean theorem, laying the foundation for geometry
story: 毕达哥拉斯创立了一个神秘的学派，他们相信'万物皆数'。传说他在观察地砖时发现了这个定理。他的学生们发誓保守秘密，违者会被扔进海里！
story_en: Pythagoras founded a mysterious school that believed 'all is number'. Legend says he discovered this theorem while observing floor tiles. His students swore to keep secrets, violators would be thrown into the sea!
fun_fact: 毕达哥拉斯学派不吃豆子，因为他们认为豆子里住着人的灵魂。他们还相信数字有神奇的力量！
fun_fact_en: Pythagoreans didn't eat beans because they believed beans contained human souls. They also believed numbers had magical powers!
impact: 这个定理成为几何学的基石，今天建筑师、工程师每天都在使用它来确保建筑物是方正的。
impact_en: This theorem became the cornerstone of geometry. Today, architects and engineers use it daily to ensure buildings are square.
kid_friendly_explanation: 想象一个直角三角形，如果你知道两条边的长度，就能算出第三条边。就像拼图一样，a²+b²=c²！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Imagine a right triangle. If you know two sides, you can calculate the third. Like a puzzle: a²+b²=c²!

quiz.question: 毕达哥拉斯定理适用于什么形状？
quiz.question_en: What shape does the Pythagorean theorem apply to?

title: 欧几里得《几何原本》
description: 欧几里得编写了《几何原本》，系统化了几何学知识，成为数学史上最重要的著作之一
description_en: Euclid wrote 'Elements', systematizing geometric knowledge, becoming one of the most important works in mathematics history
story: 在亚历山大图书馆，欧几里得把所有已知的几何知识整理成13卷书。国王问他有没有学几何的捷径，欧几里得回答：'几何学中没有王者之路！'
story_en: At the Library of Alexandria, Euclid organized all known geometric knowledge into 13 books. When the king asked if there was a shortcut to learning geometry, Euclid replied: 'There is no royal road to geometry!'
fun_fact: 《几何原本》是历史上除了《圣经》外印刷次数最多的书！它被使用了2000多年。
fun_fact_en: Elements is the most printed book in history after the Bible! It has been used for over 2000 years.
impact: 这本书定义了逻辑推理的方法，影响了整个西方科学的发展方式。
impact_en: This book defined the method of logical reasoning, influencing the entire development of Western science.
kid_friendly_explanation: 欧几里得就像写了一本超级数学教科书，从最简单的点和线开始，一步步推导出所有几何知识。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Euclid wrote a super math textbook, starting from simple points and lines, step by step deriving all geometric knowledge.

quiz.question: 欧几里得在哪里工作？
quiz.question_en: Where did Euclid work?

title: 阿基米德浮力定律
description: 阿基米德发现了浮力原理和杠杆定律，是古代最伟大的科学家之一
description_en: Archimedes discovered the principle of buoyancy and the law of the lever, one of the greatest scientists of antiquity
story: 国王让阿基米德检验王冠是不是纯金的。阿基米德苦思不得其解。有一天他泡澡时，看到水溢出来，突然灵光一现，光着身子跑到街上大喊'尤里卡！'（我发现了！）
story_en: The king asked Archimedes to verify if the crown was pure gold. While bathing, he noticed water overflow and had an epiphany. He ran naked through the streets shouting 'Eureka!' (I found it!)
fun_fact: 阿基米德说过：'给我一个支点，我能撬动地球！'他还发明了很多战争武器保卫家乡。
fun_fact_en: Archimedes said: 'Give me a place to stand, and I shall move the Earth!' He also invented many war machines to defend his homeland.
impact: 浮力定律让人类理解了船为什么能浮在水上，帮助我们建造了巨大的轮船。
impact_en: The principle of buoyancy helped humans understand why ships float, enabling us to build massive vessels.
kid_friendly_explanation: 把东西放进水里，水会把它往上推。推的力量等于它排开的水的重量。这就是为什么你在水里感觉变轻了！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: When you put something in water, water pushes it up. The pushing force equals the weight of water displaced. That's why you feel lighter in water!

quiz.question: 阿基米德在哪里发现了浮力原理？
quiz.question_en: Where did Archimedes discover the principle of buoyancy?

title: 张衡地动仪
description: 张衡发明了世界上第一台地震仪，能够探测遥远地方的地震
description_en: Zhang Heng invented the world's first seismoscope, capable of detecting distant earthquakes
story: 张衡制作了一个大铜罐，外面有8条龙，每条龙嘴里含着铜球。下面有8只蛤蟆张着嘴。地震时，龙嘴里的球会掉进蛤蟆嘴里，发出声音，还能指示地震方向！
story_en: Zhang Heng created a large bronze vessel with 8 dragons, each holding a copper ball. Below were 8 toads with open mouths. During earthquakes, balls would drop into the toads' mouths, making sounds and indicating the earthquake's direction!
fun_fact: 张衡不仅是科学家，还是诗人和画家。他还改进了浑天仪，能够演示天体运动。
fun_fact_en: Zhang Heng was not only a scientist but also a poet and painter. He also improved the armillary sphere to demonstrate celestial movements.
impact: 这是人类历史上第一台地震监测仪器，比欧洲早了1700多年！
impact_en: This was humanity's first earthquake monitoring instrument, 1700 years ahead of Europe!
kid_friendly_explanation: 想象一个聪明的机器，当远处地震时，它能感觉到地面的震动，然后告诉你地震在哪个方向。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Imagine a smart machine that can feel ground vibrations from distant earthquakes and tell you which direction they came from.

quiz.question: 张衡地动仪用什么动物来指示方向？
quiz.question_en: What animals did Zhang Heng's seismoscope use to indicate direction?

title: 花拉子米代数学
description: 花拉子米创立了代数学，'算法'一词就来源于他的名字
description_en: Al-Khwarizmi founded algebra, and the word 'algorithm' comes from his name
story: 在巴格达的智慧宫，花拉子米写了一本书叫《还原与对消计算概要》。这本书教人们如何用字母代替数字来解方程，开创了代数学。
story_en: At Baghdad's House of Wisdom, Al-Khwarizmi wrote 'The Compendious Book on Calculation by Completion and Balancing', teaching people to use letters instead of numbers to solve equations, founding algebra.
fun_fact: '算法'（Algorithm）这个词就是从他的名字Al-Khwarizmi演变来的。我们今天用的阿拉伯数字也是他引入欧洲的！
fun_fact_en: The word 'Algorithm' evolved from his name Al-Khwarizmi. He also introduced Arabic numerals to Europe!
impact: 代数学让数学从具体的数字计算变成了抽象的符号运算，是现代数学的基础。
impact_en: Algebra transformed mathematics from concrete numerical calculations to abstract symbolic operations, forming the foundation of modern mathematics.
kid_friendly_explanation: 以前算数只能用具体数字，花拉子米说：'我们可以用x、y这些字母代表未知数！'这样就能解决更复杂的问题了。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Before, math only used specific numbers. Al-Khwarizmi said: 'We can use letters like x and y for unknowns!' This solved more complex problems.

quiz.question: '算法'这个词来源于谁的名字？
quiz.question_en: Whose name does the word 'algorithm' come from?

title: 海什木光学
description: 伊本·海什木被称为'现代光学之父'，研究了光的反射和折射
description_en: Ibn al-Haytham, called the 'Father of Modern Optics', studied light reflection and refraction
story: 海什木不同意古希腊人的观点（认为眼睛发出光线）。他通过实验证明：是光进入眼睛，我们才能看见东西！他还研究了彩虹和日食。
story_en: Ibn al-Haytham disagreed with ancient Greeks who thought eyes emit light. He proved through experiments that light enters the eye for us to see! He also studied rainbows and eclipses.
fun_fact: 海什木写了一本7卷的《光学书》，这本书后来被翻译成拉丁文，影响了欧洲文艺复兴时期的科学家。
fun_fact_en: Ibn al-Haytham wrote a 7-volume 'Book of Optics', later translated into Latin, influencing Renaissance scientists in Europe.
impact: 他的研究奠定了现代光学基础，帮助后人发明了眼镜、望远镜和照相机。
impact_en: His research laid the foundation for modern optics, helping later inventors create eyeglasses, telescopes, and cameras.
kid_friendly_explanation: 海什木发现：我们能看见东西，不是因为眼睛发出光，而是因为光反射到眼睛里。就像镜子反射光一样！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Ibn al-Haytham discovered: we see things not because eyes emit light, but because light reflects into our eyes. Like a mirror reflecting light!

quiz.question: 我们为什么能看见东西？
quiz.question_en: Why can we see things?

title: 沈括《梦溪笔谈》
description: 沈括的《梦溪笔谈》记录了大量科技成就，包括指南针、活字印刷等
description_en: Shen Kuo's 'Dream Pool Essays' recorded numerous scientific achievements, including the compass and movable type printing
story: 沈括晚年住在梦溪园，把一生的见闻和研究写成了《梦溪笔谈》。这本书像百科全书，记录了天文、数学、物理、化学、生物、地理等各方面的知识。
story_en: In his later years, Shen Kuo lived at Dream Pool Garden and compiled his lifetime observations into 'Dream Pool Essays'. This encyclopedia-like book covered astronomy, mathematics, physics, chemistry, biology, geography, and more.
fun_fact: 沈括发现了磁偏角（指南针不是正好指向南北），比欧洲早了400年！他还研究过化石，知道古代的气候和现在不一样。
fun_fact_en: Shen Kuo discovered magnetic declination (compass doesn't point exactly north-south), 400 years before Europe! He also studied fossils, understanding ancient climates differed from today.
impact: 这本书保存了宋代的科技成就，被誉为'中国科学史上的坐标'。
impact_en: This book preserved Song Dynasty scientific achievements, hailed as a 'milestone in Chinese science history'.
kid_friendly_explanation: 沈括就像一个超级好奇的人，对什么都感兴趣。他把看到的、想到的都记下来，成了一本超级有趣的科学笔记！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Shen Kuo was like a super curious person interested in everything. He wrote down what he saw and thought, creating a super interesting science notebook!

quiz.question: 沈括发现了指南针的什么秘密？
quiz.question_en: What secret about the compass did Shen Kuo discover?

title: 斐波那契数列
description: 斐波那契将阿拉伯数字引入欧洲，发现了著名的斐波那契数列
description_en: Fibonacci introduced Arabic numerals to Europe and discovered the famous Fibonacci sequence
story: 斐波那契在研究兔子繁殖问题时，发现了一个神奇的数列：1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13...每个数都是前两个数的和！
story_en: While studying rabbit reproduction, Fibonacci discovered a magical sequence: 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13... each number is the sum of the previous two!
fun_fact: 这个数列在自然界到处都是：向日葵的种子排列、松果的螺旋、鹦鹉螺的壳，甚至星系的形状！
fun_fact_en: This sequence appears everywhere in nature: sunflower seed arrangements, pinecone spirals, nautilus shells, even galaxy shapes!
impact: 斐波那契数列不仅在数学中重要，在艺术、建筑、音乐中也有应用。黄金分割比例就与它有关。
impact_en: The Fibonacci sequence is important not only in mathematics but also in art, architecture, and music. The golden ratio is related to it.
kid_friendly_explanation: 从1和1开始，每次把前面两个数加起来得到下一个数：1+1=2, 1+2=3, 2+3=5...这个规律在大自然中到处都能找到！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Starting with 1 and 1, add the previous two numbers to get the next: 1+1=2, 1+2=3, 2+3=5... This pattern is found everywhere in nature!

quiz.question: 斐波那契数列中，3后面是哪个数？
quiz.question_en: In the Fibonacci sequence, what number comes after 3?

title: 哥白尼日心说
description: 哥白尼提出日心说，认为地球和其他行星围绕太阳转，挑战了统治千年的地心说
description_en: Copernicus proposed heliocentrism, arguing Earth and other planets orbit the Sun, challenging the millennium-old geocentric model
story: 哥白尼花了30多年研究天文，发现如果把太阳放在中心，行星运动就变得简单多了。但他害怕被教会迫害，直到临终前才出版这本书。
story_en: Copernicus spent over 30 years studying astronomy, finding that placing the Sun at the center made planetary motion much simpler. Fearing Church persecution, he only published his book on his deathbed.
fun_fact: 哥白尼的书被教会禁了200多年！但真理终究会胜利，现在我们都知道地球确实绕着太阳转。
fun_fact_en: Copernicus's book was banned by the Church for over 200 years! But truth prevails—we now know Earth indeed orbits the Sun.
impact: 日心说引发了科学革命，改变了人类对宇宙和自己位置的认识，是人类思想史上的重大转折。
impact_en: Heliocentrism sparked the Scientific Revolution, changing humanity's understanding of the universe and our place in it—a major turning point in intellectual history.
kid_friendly_explanation: 以前人们以为地球是宇宙的中心，太阳和星星都绕着我们转。哥白尼说：'不对！是地球绕着太阳转！'
kid_friendly_explanation_en: People used to think Earth was the center of the universe, with the Sun and stars orbiting us. Copernicus said: 'No! Earth orbits the Sun!'

quiz.question: 哥白尼认为什么是宇宙的中心？
quiz.question_en: What did Copernicus believe was the center of the universe?

title: 维萨里人体解剖学
description: 维萨里通过亲自解剖人体，纠正了许多医学错误，被称为现代解剖学之父
description_en: Vesalius corrected many medical errors through personal dissection, earning the title 'Father of Modern Anatomy'
story: 维萨里不满足于读古书，他亲自解剖尸体研究人体结构。他发现古希腊医生盖伦的很多说法是错的（因为盖伦只解剖过动物）。
story_en: Unsatisfied with reading ancient texts, Vesalius personally dissected corpses to study human anatomy. He found many claims by ancient Greek physician Galen were wrong (Galen only dissected animals).
fun_fact: 维萨里的解剖学书里有精美的插图，画的是肌肉人在各种姿势下的样子，既科学又艺术！
fun_fact_en: Vesalius's anatomy book contained exquisite illustrations of muscular figures in various poses—both scientific and artistic!
impact: 维萨里开创了通过实际观察研究人体的传统，为现代医学奠定了基础。
impact_en: Vesalius pioneered the tradition of studying the human body through direct observation, laying the foundation for modern medicine.
kid_friendly_explanation: 维萨里就像一个勇敢的探险家，探索人体这个神秘的世界，画出了详细的'人体地图'。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Vesalius was like a brave explorer, exploring the mysterious world of the human body and drawing detailed 'body maps'.

quiz.question: 维萨里通过什么方法研究人体？
quiz.question_en: How did Vesalius study the human body?

title: 伽利略望远镜观测
description: 伽利略用自制望远镜观测天体，发现了木星的卫星，支持了日心说
description_en: Galileo used his homemade telescope to observe celestial bodies, discovering Jupiter's moons and supporting heliocentrism
story: 伽利略听说荷兰人发明了望远镜，就自己做了一个更好的。他把望远镜对准天空，看到了月球上的山脉、木星的4颗卫星，还有银河是由无数星星组成的！
story_en: Hearing the Dutch invented the telescope, Galileo made a better one. He pointed it at the sky, seeing mountains on the Moon, Jupiter's 4 moons, and that the Milky Way consists of countless stars!
fun_fact: 伽利略因为支持日心说被教会软禁在家，但他偷偷继续研究。传说他在法庭上小声说：'但地球确实在转动！'
fun_fact_en: Galileo was placed under house arrest by the Church for supporting heliocentrism, but he secretly continued his research. Legend says he whispered in court: 'And yet it moves!'
impact: 伽利略的观测提供了日心说的直接证据，开创了用望远镜观测天文的时代。
impact_en: Galileo's observations provided direct evidence for heliocentrism, inaugurating the era of telescopic astronomy.
kid_friendly_explanation: 伽利略做了一个超级厉害的望远镜，第一次让人类看清了月球、行星和星星的真面目！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Galileo made a super powerful telescope, letting humans see the Moon, planets, and stars clearly for the first time!

quiz.question: 伽利略用望远镜发现了木星有几颗卫星？
quiz.question_en: How many moons of Jupiter did Galileo discover with his telescope?

title: 开普勒行星运动定律
description: 开普勒发现行星沿椭圆轨道运动，提出了行星运动三大定律
description_en: Kepler discovered planets move in elliptical orbits, proposing three laws of planetary motion
story: 开普勒分析了他老师第谷20年的观测数据，发现行星轨道不是圆形而是椭圆形！这个发现让他激动得睡不着觉。
story_en: Kepler analyzed 20 years of observational data from his teacher Tycho, discovering planetary orbits are elliptical, not circular! This discovery kept him awake with excitement.
fun_fact: 开普勒相信宇宙是按照音乐的和谐规律运行的，他甚至为每个行星写了一首'天体音乐'！
fun_fact_en: Kepler believed the universe operated according to musical harmony, even composing 'music of the spheres' for each planet!
impact: 开普勒定律精确描述了行星运动，为牛顿发现万有引力定律铺平了道路。
impact_en: Kepler's laws precisely described planetary motion, paving the way for Newton's discovery of universal gravitation.
kid_friendly_explanation: 开普勒发现：行星绕太阳转的轨道不是正圆形，而是椭圆形（像压扁的圆）。离太阳近时跑得快，远时跑得慢。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Kepler discovered: planets orbit the Sun in ellipses (like squashed circles), not perfect circles. They move faster when closer to the Sun, slower when farther.

quiz.question: 行星绕太阳的轨道是什么形状？
quiz.question_en: What shape are planetary orbits around the Sun?

title: 哈维血液循环
description: 威廉·哈维发现了血液循环系统，证明心脏是血液循环的动力
description_en: William Harvey discovered the circulatory system, proving the heart is the pump driving blood circulation
story: 哈维通过解剖和实验，发现血液不是像古人说的那样在身体里来回晃荡，而是由心脏泵出，经过动脉到全身，再通过静脉回到心脏，形成一个循环！
story_en: Through dissection and experiments, Harvey discovered blood doesn't slosh around the body as ancients thought, but is pumped by the heart through arteries to the body, returning via veins in a circuit!
fun_fact: 哈维计算过：如果血液不循环，心脏每小时要产生540磅血液，这显然不可能！
fun_fact_en: Harvey calculated: if blood didn't circulate, the heart would need to produce 540 pounds of blood per hour—clearly impossible!
impact: 血液循环的发现是医学史上的里程碑，为后来的输血、心脏手术等医疗技术奠定了基础。
impact_en: The discovery of blood circulation was a medical milestone, laying the foundation for blood transfusions, heart surgery, and other medical techniques.
kid_friendly_explanation: 你的心脏就像一个水泵，把血液泵到全身，给每个细胞送氧气和营养，然后血液再回到心脏，周而复始！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Your heart is like a pump, pumping blood throughout your body, delivering oxygen and nutrients to every cell, then blood returns to the heart, over and over!

quiz.question: 血液循环的动力来自哪里？
quiz.question_en: Where does the power for blood circulation come from?

title: 笛卡尔解析几何
description: 笛卡尔创立了解析几何，用代数方法研究几何问题
description_en: Descartes founded analytic geometry, using algebraic methods to study geometric problems
story: 传说笛卡尔生病躺在床上，看着天花板上的一只苍蝇，突然想到：可以用两个数字（横坐标和纵坐标）来表示苍蝇的位置！这就是坐标系的由来。
story_en: Legend says Descartes, sick in bed, watched a fly on the ceiling and realized: you can use two numbers (x and y coordinates) to represent the fly's position! Thus the coordinate system was born.
fun_fact: 笛卡尔说过那句著名的话：'我思故我在'。他既是数学家，也是哲学家！
fun_fact_en: Descartes said the famous phrase: 'I think, therefore I am.' He was both a mathematician and philosopher!
impact: 解析几何把代数和几何连接起来，让数学变得更强大，是现代数学的重要基础。
impact_en: Analytic geometry connected algebra and geometry, making mathematics more powerful—an important foundation of modern mathematics.
kid_friendly_explanation: 笛卡尔发明了坐标系（就像地图上的经纬度），让我们可以用数字来描述图形的位置和形状。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Descartes invented the coordinate system (like latitude and longitude on maps), letting us describe shapes' positions and forms with numbers.

quiz.question: 笛卡尔坐标系用几个数字表示平面上的一个点？
quiz.question_en: How many numbers does the Cartesian coordinate system use to represent a point on a plane?

title: 帕斯卡概率论
description: 帕斯卡与费马通过书信往来，共同创立了概率论
description_en: Pascal and Fermat, through correspondence, jointly founded probability theory
story: 一个赌徒问帕斯卡：如果赌局中途停止，赌注该怎么分？帕斯卡和费马通过书信讨论这个问题，创立了概率论！
story_en: A gambler asked Pascal: if a game stops midway, how should the stakes be divided? Pascal and Fermat discussed this through letters, founding probability theory!
fun_fact: 帕斯卡还发明了世界上第一台机械计算器，帮他父亲（税务官）计算税款。他当时才19岁！
fun_fact_en: Pascal also invented the world's first mechanical calculator to help his father (a tax collector) calculate taxes. He was only 19!
impact: 概率论不仅用于赌博，还广泛应用于保险、金融、天气预报、人工智能等领域。
impact_en: Probability theory is used not only in gambling but widely in insurance, finance, weather forecasting, artificial intelligence, and more.
kid_friendly_explanation: 概率就是某件事发生的可能性有多大。比如抛硬币，正面朝上的概率是50%，因为有两种可能，正面是其中一种。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Probability is how likely something is to happen. For example, flipping a coin has a 50% chance of heads because there are two possibilities, and heads is one.

quiz.question: 抛一枚硬币，正面朝上的概率是多少？
quiz.question_en: What's the probability of a coin landing heads?

title: 胡克显微镜观察
description: 罗伯特·胡克用显微镜观察软木，首次发现并命名了'细胞'
description_en: Robert Hooke observed cork with a microscope, first discovering and naming 'cells'
story: 胡克用自制的显微镜观察软木薄片，看到了许多小格子，像蜂巢一样。他把这些小格子叫做'cell'（细胞），这个词原意是'小房间'。
story_en: Hooke observed cork slices with his homemade microscope, seeing many small compartments like a honeycomb. He called these 'cells', originally meaning 'small rooms'.
fun_fact: 胡克的书《显微图谱》里有精美的插图，包括放大的跳蚤、虱子等，让人们第一次看到微观世界的奇妙！
fun_fact_en: Hooke's book 'Micrographia' contained exquisite illustrations of magnified fleas, lice, etc., letting people see the microscopic world's wonders for the first time!
impact: 细胞的发现开启了细胞生物学，让人类理解生命是由细胞组成的。
impact_en: The discovery of cells launched cell biology, helping humans understand life is composed of cells.
kid_friendly_explanation: 胡克用显微镜看到了肉眼看不见的微小世界，发现所有生物都是由叫做'细胞'的小单位组成的。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Hooke used a microscope to see the tiny world invisible to the naked eye, discovering all living things are made of small units called 'cells'.

quiz.question: 胡克用什么工具发现了细胞？
quiz.question_en: What tool did Hooke use to discover cells?

title: 牛顿《原理》
description: 艾萨克·牛顿发表《自然哲学的数学原理》，建立了经典力学体系
description_en: Isaac Newton published 'Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy', establishing classical mechanics
story: 1666年，23岁的牛顿在家乡躲避瘟疫。一天，他坐在苹果树下思考，一个苹果掉下来。牛顿想：为什么苹果总是往下掉？为什么月亮不会掉下来？经过20年研究，他在1687年出版了这本改变世界的书。
story_en: In 1666, 23-year-old Newton was avoiding the plague in his hometown. One day, sitting under an apple tree, an apple fell. Newton wondered: why do apples always fall down? Why doesn't the Moon fall? After 20 years of research, he published this world-changing book in 1687.
fun_fact: 牛顿其实脾气很坏，和很多科学家吵过架。他还当过英国皇家铸币厂厂长，专门抓造假币的人！
fun_fact_en: Newton actually had a bad temper and quarreled with many scientists. He also served as Master of the Royal Mint, catching counterfeiters!
impact: 牛顿的理论让人类第一次能够精确预测天体运动，后来帮助人类发射卫星、登上月球。
impact_en: Newton's theory enabled humans to precisely predict celestial motion for the first time, later helping launch satellites and land on the Moon.
kid_friendly_explanation: 想象地球是一个超级大磁铁，把所有东西都吸向它。你跳起来会落下，月亮绕着地球转，都是因为这个'引力'。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Imagine Earth is a super magnet pulling everything toward it. You fall when you jump, the Moon orbits Earth—all because of this 'gravity'.
influence_story: 牛顿站在巨人的肩膀上：他综合了伽利略的运动学、开普勒的行星定律和笛卡尔的数学方法，创造了统一的力学体系。200年后，爱因斯坦发现牛顿理论在极高速度下不准确，于是发展出相对论。但牛顿力学仍然是我们日常生活和工程中最实用的理论！
influence_story_en: Newton stood on the shoulders of giants: he synthesized Galileo's kinematics, Kepler's planetary laws, and Descartes' mathematical methods, creating a unified mechanical system. 200 years later, Einstein found Newton's theory inaccurate at extreme speeds, developing relativity. But Newtonian mechanics remains the most practical theory for daily life and engineering!

quiz.question: 牛顿在哪里得到灵感发现万有引力？
quiz.question_en: Where did Newton get inspiration to discover universal gravitation?

title: 莱布尼茨微积分
description: 莱布尼茨独立发明了微积分，并创造了现在通用的微积分符号
description_en: Leibniz independently invented calculus and created the notation still used today
story: 莱布尼茨和牛顿几乎同时发明了微积分，两人还为此争论谁先发明的。其实他们是独立发现的，但莱布尼茨的符号（dx、dy、∫）更好用，现在大家都在用！
story_en: Leibniz and Newton invented calculus almost simultaneously, even arguing over who was first. They actually discovered it independently, but Leibniz's notation (dx, dy, ∫) was better—everyone uses it now!
fun_fact: 莱布尼茨不仅是数学家，还是哲学家、外交官、历史学家。他甚至设计过一种计算机器！
fun_fact_en: Leibniz wasn't just a mathematician but also a philosopher, diplomat, and historian. He even designed a calculating machine!
impact: 微积分是现代科学和工程的基础工具，用于研究变化和运动。
impact_en: Calculus is a fundamental tool of modern science and engineering, used to study change and motion.
kid_friendly_explanation: 微积分就像一个超级放大镜，能把曲线分成无数小段来研究。就像把电影分成一帧一帧的画面。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Calculus is like a super magnifying glass, breaking curves into countless tiny segments to study. Like breaking a movie into individual frames.

quiz.question: 现在通用的微积分符号是谁发明的？
quiz.question_en: Who invented the calculus notation used today?

title: 林奈生物分类
description: 林奈建立了现代生物分类系统，用双名法给生物命名
description_en: Linnaeus established the modern biological classification system, using binomial nomenclature to name organisms
story: 林奈从小就喜欢植物，他走遍瑞典收集标本。他发明了一套分类系统：界、门、纲、目、科、属、种，就像给生物建了一个家谱树。
story_en: Linnaeus loved plants from childhood, traveling throughout Sweden collecting specimens. He invented a classification system: kingdom, phylum, class, order, family, genus, species—like building a family tree for organisms.
fun_fact: 林奈给每个生物起两个拉丁名字（属名+种名），就像人的姓和名。比如人类叫Homo sapiens（智人）。
fun_fact_en: Linnaeus gave each organism two Latin names (genus + species), like a person's surname and given name. For example, humans are Homo sapiens (wise man).
impact: 林奈的分类系统让全世界科学家能用统一的语言交流，至今仍在使用。
impact_en: Linnaeus's classification system enabled scientists worldwide to communicate in a unified language, still used today.
kid_friendly_explanation: 林奈就像给所有生物建了一个超大的家谱，把相似的生物归为一类，让我们能更好地认识大自然。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Linnaeus built a huge family tree for all living things, grouping similar organisms together, helping us better understand nature.

quiz.question: 人类的学名是什么？
quiz.question_en: What is the scientific name for humans?

title: 拉瓦锡化学革命
description: 拉瓦锡发现了质量守恒定律，建立了现代化学的基础
description_en: Lavoisier discovered the law of conservation of mass, establishing the foundation of modern chemistry
story: 拉瓦锡用精密的天平做实验，发现化学反应前后物质的总质量不变。他还发现燃烧需要氧气，推翻了'燃素说'。
story_en: Lavoisier used precise scales in experiments, discovering that total mass remains constant before and after chemical reactions. He also found combustion requires oxygen, overthrowing the 'phlogiston theory'.
fun_fact: 拉瓦锡在法国大革命时被送上断头台。他请求推迟行刑以完成实验，但被拒绝了。法官说：'共和国不需要科学家！'
fun_fact_en: Lavoisier was guillotined during the French Revolution. He requested a delay to finish experiments but was refused. The judge said: 'The Republic needs no scientists!'
impact: 拉瓦锡的工作标志着现代化学的诞生，他被称为'化学之父'。
impact_en: Lavoisier's work marked the birth of modern chemistry; he's called the 'Father of Chemistry'.
kid_friendly_explanation: 拉瓦锡发现：东西烧掉后，虽然看起来消失了，但其实只是变成了烟和灰，总重量是一样的。物质不会凭空消失！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Lavoisier discovered: when things burn, though they seem to disappear, they just turn into smoke and ash—the total weight stays the same. Matter doesn't vanish!

quiz.question: 化学反应前后什么保持不变？
quiz.question_en: What remains constant before and after a chemical reaction?

title: 伏打电池
description: 亚历山德罗·伏打发明了第一个化学电池，开启了电气时代
description_en: Alessandro Volta invented the first chemical battery, inaugurating the electrical age
story: 伏打把锌片和铜片交替堆叠，中间用浸过盐水的纸隔开，制成了'伏打电堆'。这是人类第一次能够持续产生电流！
story_en: Volta stacked zinc and copper plates alternately, separated by paper soaked in saltwater, creating the 'voltaic pile'. This was humanity's first continuous source of electric current!
fun_fact: 电压的单位'伏特'（Volt）就是以伏打的名字命名的。拿破仑还亲自给他颁过奖！
fun_fact_en: The unit of voltage 'Volt' is named after Volta. Napoleon personally awarded him a prize!
impact: 伏打电池的发明让人类能够稳定地使用电力，为后来的电报、电话、电灯等发明铺平了道路。
impact_en: Volta's battery invention enabled stable use of electricity, paving the way for telegraphs, telephones, electric lights, and more.
kid_friendly_explanation: 伏打发现把不同的金属片和化学物质组合起来，就能产生电！就像你用的电池一样。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Volta discovered that combining different metal plates with chemicals produces electricity! Just like the batteries you use.

quiz.question: 电压的单位'伏特'是为了纪念谁？
quiz.question_en: Who is the unit 'Volt' named after?

title: 道尔顿原子论
description: 约翰·道尔顿提出了现代原子理论，认为物质由原子组成
description_en: John Dalton proposed modern atomic theory, arguing matter is composed of atoms
story: 道尔顿从小色盲，但这没有阻止他成为伟大的科学家。他提出：每种元素都由独特的原子组成，原子不能被分割，化学反应只是原子的重新组合。
story_en: Dalton was colorblind from childhood, but this didn't stop him from becoming a great scientist. He proposed: each element consists of unique atoms, atoms cannot be divided, chemical reactions are just atomic rearrangements.
fun_fact: 道尔顿研究色盲（他自己就是色盲），'色盲'在英语里有时叫'道尔顿症'（Daltonism）。
fun_fact_en: Dalton studied color blindness (he was colorblind himself); color blindness is sometimes called 'Daltonism' in English.
impact: 道尔顿的原子论为现代化学奠定了基础，帮助人们理解物质的本质。
impact_en: Dalton's atomic theory laid the foundation for modern chemistry, helping people understand the nature of matter.
kid_friendly_explanation: 想象乐高积木，每种颜色的积木就像不同的原子。不同的东西就是用这些'原子积木'搭出来的！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Imagine LEGO blocks—each color is like a different atom. Different things are built from these 'atomic blocks'!

quiz.question: 根据道尔顿的理论，物质是由什么组成的？
quiz.question_en: According to Dalton's theory, what is matter composed of?

title: 法拉第电磁感应
description: 迈克尔·法拉第发现了电磁感应现象，为发电机的发明奠定了基础
description_en: Michael Faraday discovered electromagnetic induction, laying the foundation for electric generators
story: 法拉第出身贫寒，只上过小学。他在书店当学徒时自学成才。他发现：移动磁铁能在线圈中产生电流！这个发现改变了世界。
story_en: Faraday came from poverty, only attending elementary school. Self-taught while apprenticing at a bookshop, he discovered: moving magnets generate electric current in coils! This discovery changed the world.
fun_fact: 法拉第拒绝了爵位和高薪，一生都在皇家研究所做研究。他说：'我宁愿做法拉第先生，也不要做任何爵士。'
fun_fact_en: Faraday refused knighthood and high salaries, spending his life researching at the Royal Institution. He said: 'I prefer to remain plain Mr. Faraday to the end.'
impact: 电磁感应是发电机和变压器的工作原理，让大规模发电和输电成为可能，开启了电气时代。
impact_en: Electromagnetic induction is the principle behind generators and transformers, enabling large-scale power generation and transmission, inaugurating the electrical age.
kid_friendly_explanation: 法拉第发现：转动磁铁能产生电！这就是发电机的原理。你家的电就是这样来的！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Faraday discovered: rotating magnets generate electricity! This is how generators work. That's where your home's electricity comes from!

quiz.question: 法拉第发现移动磁铁能产生什么？
quiz.question_en: What did Faraday discover moving magnets produce?

title: 达尔文进化论
description: 查尔斯·达尔文发表《物种起源》，提出了自然选择的进化理论
description_en: Charles Darwin published 'On the Origin of Species', proposing the theory of evolution by natural selection
story: 达尔文乘坐'小猎犬号'环球航行5年，在加拉帕戈斯群岛观察到不同岛上的雀鸟喙形状不同。他思考了20年，才发表进化论。
story_en: Darwin sailed around the world for 5 years on the HMS Beagle, observing different beak shapes in finches on different Galápagos islands. He pondered for 20 years before publishing his theory of evolution.
fun_fact: 达尔文差点当牧师！他在剑桥大学学的是神学。但他对自然的热爱让他走上了科学之路。
fun_fact_en: Darwin almost became a clergyman! He studied theology at Cambridge. But his love of nature led him to science.
impact: 进化论彻底改变了人类对生命起源的认识，是现代生物学的基石。
impact_en: Evolution theory completely changed humanity's understanding of life's origins, becoming the cornerstone of modern biology.
kid_friendly_explanation: 达尔文发现：生物会慢慢改变，适应环境的生物能生存下来，把特点传给后代。就像长颈鹿的脖子越来越长，因为能吃到高处的叶子！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Darwin discovered: organisms slowly change, those adapted to their environment survive and pass traits to offspring. Like giraffes' necks getting longer because they could reach high leaves!

quiz.question: 达尔文在哪里观察到了不同的雀鸟？
quiz.question_en: Where did Darwin observe different finches?

title: 孟德尔遗传定律
description: 格雷戈尔·孟德尔通过豌豆实验，发现了遗传的基本规律
description_en: Gregor Mendel discovered the basic laws of inheritance through pea plant experiments
story: 孟德尔是个修道士，在修道院的花园里种了上万株豌豆。他仔细记录豌豆的高矮、颜色等特征，发现了遗传的规律。
story_en: Mendel was a monk who grew tens of thousands of pea plants in the monastery garden. He carefully recorded traits like height and color, discovering the laws of inheritance.
fun_fact: 孟德尔的研究在他生前没人重视，论文发表后被遗忘了35年。直到他去世后，科学家才发现这项伟大的工作！
fun_fact_en: Mendel's research was ignored during his lifetime, his paper forgotten for 35 years. Only after his death did scientists discover this great work!
impact: 孟德尔定律是现代遗传学的基础，帮助人类理解性状如何从父母传给子女。
impact_en: Mendel's laws are the foundation of modern genetics, helping humans understand how traits pass from parents to offspring.
kid_friendly_explanation: 孟德尔发现：你的特征（像眼睛颜色、身高）是从爸爸妈妈那里继承来的，而且有一定的规律！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Mendel discovered: your traits (like eye color, height) are inherited from your parents, following certain patterns!

quiz.question: 孟德尔用什么植物做实验？
quiz.question_en: What plant did Mendel use for experiments?

title: 麦克斯韦方程组
description: 詹姆斯·麦克斯韦统一了电学和磁学，预言了电磁波的存在
description_en: James Clerk Maxwell unified electricity and magnetism, predicting the existence of electromagnetic waves
story: 麦克斯韦用4个优美的方程，把电和磁统一起来。他还预言：光就是一种电磁波！后来赫兹证实了电磁波的存在。
story_en: Maxwell unified electricity and magnetism with 4 elegant equations. He also predicted: light is an electromagnetic wave! Later, Hertz confirmed electromagnetic waves exist.
fun_fact: 麦克斯韦还拍摄了世界上第一张彩色照片！他用红、绿、蓝三色滤镜分别拍照，再合成彩色图像。
fun_fact_en: Maxwell also took the world's first color photograph! He photographed through red, green, and blue filters, then combined them into a color image.
impact: 麦克斯韦方程组是物理学最伟大的成就之一，为无线电、电视、手机等技术奠定了理论基础。
impact_en: Maxwell's equations are one of physics' greatest achievements, providing the theoretical foundation for radio, television, mobile phones, and more.
influence_story: 麦克斯韦继承了法拉第的电磁感应实验，用牛顿的数学方法建立了方程组。他预言光速恒定，这个发现困扰了物理学家40年，直到爱因斯坦用相对论解决了这个矛盾。麦克斯韦方程也是量子电动力学的基础，影响了整个20世纪的物理学发展。
influence_story_en: Maxwell built on Faraday's electromagnetic induction experiments, using Newton's mathematical methods to establish his equations. He predicted constant light speed, puzzling physicists for 40 years until Einstein resolved this with relativity. Maxwell's equations also underpin quantum electrodynamics, influencing all of 20th-century physics.
kid_friendly_explanation: 麦克斯韦发现电和磁其实是一家人，它们能产生波（电磁波）。光、无线电波、WiFi信号都是电磁波！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Maxwell discovered electricity and magnetism are related, producing waves (electromagnetic waves). Light, radio waves, WiFi signals are all electromagnetic waves!

quiz.question: 麦克斯韦预言光是什么？
quiz.question_en: What did Maxwell predict light is?

title: 巴斯德微生物学
description: 路易·巴斯德证明了微生物致病理论，发明了巴氏消毒法
description_en: Louis Pasteur proved germ theory of disease, inventing pasteurization
story: 巴斯德用'鹅颈瓶'实验证明：细菌不会凭空产生，而是从空气中来的。他还发明了疫苗，拯救了无数生命。
story_en: Pasteur used 'swan-neck flask' experiments to prove: bacteria don't spontaneously generate but come from the air. He also invented vaccines, saving countless lives.
fun_fact: 巴斯德救了一个被疯狗咬的小男孩，给他注射了狂犬病疫苗。这是人类历史上第一次用疫苗救人！
fun_fact_en: Pasteur saved a boy bitten by a rabid dog by injecting him with rabies vaccine. This was humanity's first time saving someone with a vaccine!
impact: 巴斯德的工作奠定了微生物学和免疫学基础，让人类理解了疾病的原因，学会了预防疾病。
impact_en: Pasteur's work laid the foundation for microbiology and immunology, helping humans understand disease causes and learn disease prevention.
kid_friendly_explanation: 巴斯德发现：很多疾病是由看不见的小生物（细菌）引起的。把牛奶加热（巴氏消毒）能杀死细菌，让牛奶更安全！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Pasteur discovered: many diseases are caused by invisible tiny organisms (bacteria). Heating milk (pasteurization) kills bacteria, making milk safer!

quiz.question: 巴氏消毒法主要用来杀死什么？
quiz.question_en: What does pasteurization mainly kill?

title: 伦琴发现X射线
description: 威廉·伦琴发现了X射线，开创了医学影像时代
description_en: Wilhelm Röntgen discovered X-rays, inaugurating the era of medical imaging
story: 1895年11月8日晚上，伦琴在实验室做实验，发现一种神秘的射线能穿透纸张。他用这种射线给妻子的手拍了照，能看到骨头！
story_en: On the evening of November 8, 1895, Röntgen was experimenting in his lab and discovered mysterious rays that could penetrate paper. He X-rayed his wife's hand, seeing bones!
fun_fact: 伦琴把这种射线叫'X射线'，X代表未知。他拒绝为X射线申请专利，希望全人类都能受益。
fun_fact_en: Röntgen called these rays 'X-rays', X representing unknown. He refused to patent X-rays, hoping all humanity could benefit.
impact: X射线让医生能看到人体内部，彻底改变了医学诊断。伦琴因此获得了第一届诺贝尔物理学奖。
impact_en: X-rays let doctors see inside the human body, completely transforming medical diagnosis. Röntgen won the first Nobel Prize in Physics for this.
kid_friendly_explanation: X射线就像超能力的眼睛，能穿透皮肤和肌肉，看到里面的骨头。医生用它来检查你有没有骨折！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: X-rays are like super-powered eyes, penetrating skin and muscle to see bones inside. Doctors use them to check if you have broken bones!

quiz.question: 伦琴用X射线拍摄了谁的手？
quiz.question_en: Whose hand did Röntgen X-ray?

title: 居里夫人发现镭
description: 玛丽·居里发现了放射性元素镭和钋，是第一位获得诺贝尔奖的女性
description_en: Marie Curie discovered radioactive elements radium and polonium, becoming the first woman to win a Nobel Prize
story: 居里夫人和丈夫在简陋的棚屋里，处理了几吨沥青铀矿，最终提炼出0.1克镭。她的笔记本至今还有放射性！
story_en: Marie Curie and her husband processed tons of pitchblende in a crude shed, finally extracting 0.1 grams of radium. Her notebooks are still radioactive today!
fun_fact: 居里夫人是唯一获得两次诺贝尔奖（物理学和化学）的女性。她的女儿也获得了诺贝尔化学奖！
fun_fact_en: Marie Curie is the only woman to win two Nobel Prizes (Physics and Chemistry). Her daughter also won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry!
impact: 放射性的发现开启了原子时代，在医学、能源等领域有重要应用。
impact_en: The discovery of radioactivity opened the atomic age, with important applications in medicine, energy, and more.
kid_friendly_explanation: 居里夫人发现有些元素会自己发光发热，这叫'放射性'。镭就是这样的元素，它能帮助治疗癌症！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Marie Curie discovered some elements glow and heat themselves—this is called 'radioactivity'. Radium is such an element, helping treat cancer!

quiz.question: 居里夫人获得了几次诺贝尔奖？
quiz.question_en: How many Nobel Prizes did Marie Curie win?

title: 普朗克量子假说
description: 马克斯·普朗克提出能量量子化假说，开创了量子力学
description_en: Max Planck proposed energy quantization hypothesis, founding quantum mechanics
story: 普朗克在研究黑体辐射问题时，大胆提出：能量不是连续的，而是一份一份的（量子）！这个想法太激进，连他自己都不太相信。
story_en: While studying blackbody radiation, Planck boldly proposed: energy isn't continuous but comes in packets (quanta)! This idea was so radical even he doubted it.
fun_fact_en: Planck's constant h is one of physics' most important constants. It's incredibly tiny: 0.000000000000000000000000000000000662!
impact: 量子理论彻底改变了物理学，解释了原子、分子的行为，为现代电子技术奠定了基础。
impact_en: Quantum theory completely transformed physics, explaining atomic and molecular behavior, laying the foundation for modern electronics.
kid_friendly_explanation: 普朗克发现：能量就像台阶，只能一级一级地跳，不能停在中间。这就是'量子'的意思！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Planck discovered: energy is like stairs—you can only jump step by step, not stop in between. That's what 'quantum' means!

quiz.question: 普朗克认为能量是怎样的？
quiz.question_en: How did Planck describe energy?

title: 爱因斯坦相对论
description: 阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦发表狭义相对论，提出了E=mc²
description_en: Albert Einstein published special relativity, proposing E=mc²
story: 1905年，26岁的爱因斯坦在专利局当小职员。这一年他发表了4篇论文，每一篇都改变了物理学！这被称为'奇迹年'。
story_en: In 1905, 26-year-old Einstein was a clerk at the patent office. That year he published 4 papers, each changing physics! This is called his 'miracle year'.
fun_fact: 爱因斯坦小时候说话很晚，父母还担心他智力有问题。他说：'想象力比知识更重要。'
fun_fact_en: Einstein spoke late as a child, worrying his parents about his intelligence. He said: 'Imagination is more important than knowledge.'
impact: 相对论改变了人类对时间、空间的认识，为核能、GPS等技术提供了理论基础。
impact_en: Relativity changed humanity's understanding of time and space, providing theoretical foundation for nuclear energy, GPS, and more.
influence_story: 爱因斯坦从牛顿那里继承了引力的概念，从麦克斯韦那里学到了光速恒定。他发现：当物体运动速度接近光速时，牛顿定律不再适用！相对论不是推翻牛顿，而是在更广阔的范围内包含了牛顿理论。后来，相对论启发了量子力学的发展，也预言了引力波的存在（100年后被证实）。
influence_story_en: Einstein inherited the concept of gravity from Newton and learned about constant light speed from Maxwell. He discovered: when objects move near light speed, Newton's laws no longer apply! Relativity didn't overthrow Newton but encompassed his theory in a broader scope. Later, relativity inspired quantum mechanics development and predicted gravitational waves (confirmed 100 years later).
kid_friendly_explanation: 爱因斯坦发现：时间和空间不是固定的！如果你跑得够快（接近光速），时间会变慢。还有，质量和能量可以互相转换（E=mc²）！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Einstein discovered: time and space aren't fixed! If you run fast enough (near light speed), time slows down. Also, mass and energy can convert into each other (E=mc²)!

quiz.question: 爱因斯坦的质能方程是什么？
quiz.question_en: What is Einstein's mass-energy equation?

title: 卢瑟福原子核模型
description: 欧内斯特·卢瑟福通过α粒子散射实验，发现了原子核
description_en: Ernest Rutherford discovered the atomic nucleus through alpha particle scattering experiments
story: 卢瑟福用α粒子轰击金箔，发现大部分粒子穿过去了，但有少数被弹回来。他惊讶地说：'就像你向一张纸发射炮弹，炮弹却弹回来打到你！'
story_en: Rutherford bombarded gold foil with alpha particles, finding most passed through but some bounced back. He exclaimed: 'It was as if you fired a cannonball at tissue paper and it bounced back and hit you!'
fun_fact: 卢瑟福获得的是诺贝尔化学奖，但他说：'所有科学不是物理学就是集邮！'他其实更喜欢物理。
fun_fact_en: Rutherford won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry, but he said: 'All science is either physics or stamp collecting!' He actually preferred physics.
impact: 原子核的发现让人类理解了原子的结构，为核能和核武器的发展奠定了基础。
impact_en: The discovery of the atomic nucleus helped humans understand atomic structure, laying the foundation for nuclear energy and weapons.
kid_friendly_explanation: 卢瑟福发现：原子不是实心球，而是像太阳系！中间有个小小的核（原子核），电子在外面转。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Rutherford discovered: atoms aren't solid balls but like solar systems! A tiny nucleus in the center, with electrons orbiting outside.

quiz.question: 卢瑟福用什么实验发现了原子核？
quiz.question_en: What experiment did Rutherford use to discover the atomic nucleus?

title: 玻尔原子模型
description: 尼尔斯·玻尔提出了量子化的原子模型
description_en: Niels Bohr proposed a quantized atomic model
story: 玻尔把量子理论应用到原子结构，提出电子只能在特定轨道上运行，就像行星绕太阳转，但轨道是量子化的。
story_en: Bohr applied quantum theory to atomic structure, proposing electrons can only orbit in specific paths, like planets around the Sun, but the orbits are quantized.
fun_fact: 玻尔和爱因斯坦是好朋友，但在量子力学的解释上争论了一辈子。爱因斯坦说：'上帝不掷骰子！'
fun_fact_en: Bohr and Einstein were good friends but debated quantum mechanics interpretation their whole lives. Einstein said: 'God does not play dice!'
impact: 玻尔模型解释了原子光谱，是量子力学发展的重要一步。
impact_en: Bohr's model explained atomic spectra, an important step in quantum mechanics development.
kid_friendly_explanation: 玻尔说：电子绕原子核转，但不能随便转，只能在固定的轨道上，就像火车只能在轨道上跑！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Bohr said: electrons orbit the nucleus but can't orbit anywhere—only in fixed paths, like trains can only run on tracks!

quiz.question: 玻尔认为电子轨道是怎样的？
quiz.question_en: How did Bohr describe electron orbits?

title: 爱因斯坦广义相对论
description: 爱因斯坦发表广义相对论，重新定义了引力
description_en: Einstein published general relativity, redefining gravity
story: 爱因斯坦思考了10年，终于完成了广义相对论。他说：引力不是一种力，而是时空的弯曲！就像在蹦床上放个重球，会把蹦床压弯。
story_en: After 10 years of thought, Einstein completed general relativity. He said: gravity isn't a force but spacetime curvature! Like placing a heavy ball on a trampoline, bending it.
fun_fact: 1919年日食时，科学家观测到星光被太阳弯曲，证实了广义相对论。爱因斯坦一夜成名，成为世界巨星！
fun_fact_en: During the 1919 solar eclipse, scientists observed starlight bending around the Sun, confirming general relativity. Einstein became an overnight celebrity!
impact: 广义相对论是现代宇宙学的基础，解释了黑洞、引力波等现象，GPS系统也需要用它来修正误差。
impact_en: General relativity is the foundation of modern cosmology, explaining black holes, gravitational waves, and more. GPS systems need it to correct errors.
kid_friendly_explanation: 爱因斯坦说：重的东西会把时空压弯，就像在床单上放个保龄球。其他东西会沿着弯曲的时空运动，这就是引力！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Einstein said: heavy objects bend spacetime, like placing a bowling ball on a bedsheet. Other objects move along curved spacetime—that's gravity!

quiz.question: 广义相对论认为引力是什么？
quiz.question_en: What does general relativity say gravity is?

title: 量子力学诞生
description: 海森堡、薛定谔等科学家建立了完整的量子力学理论
description_en: Heisenberg, Schrödinger and others established complete quantum mechanics theory
story: 1925-1927年，多位科学家从不同角度建立了量子力学。海森堡用矩阵，薛定谔用波动方程，最后发现它们是等价的！
story_en: From 1925-1927, multiple scientists built quantum mechanics from different angles. Heisenberg used matrices, Schrödinger used wave equations—they turned out to be equivalent!
fun_fact: 薛定谔提出了著名的'薛定谔的猫'思想实验：一只猫在盒子里，既是活的又是死的，直到你打开盒子观察！
fun_fact_en: Schrödinger proposed the famous 'Schrödinger's cat' thought experiment: a cat in a box is both alive and dead until you open the box and observe!
impact: 量子力学是20世纪最伟大的科学成就，解释了微观世界的规律，为半导体、激光、计算机等技术奠定了基础。
impact_en: Quantum mechanics is the 20th century's greatest scientific achievement, explaining microscopic world laws, laying the foundation for semiconductors, lasers, computers, and more.
kid_friendly_explanation: 在微观世界里，粒子的行为很奇怪：它可以同时在两个地方，可以穿墙而过！只有当你观察它时，它才会'决定'自己在哪里。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: In the microscopic world, particles behave strangely: they can be in two places at once, pass through walls! Only when you observe them do they 'decide' where they are.

quiz.question: 薛定谔的猫在盒子里是什么状态？
quiz.question_en: What state is Schrödinger's cat in the box?

title: 弗莱明发现青霉素
description: 亚历山大·弗莱明偶然发现了第一种抗生素——青霉素
description_en: Alexander Fleming accidentally discovered the first antibiotic—penicillin
story: 1928年，弗莱明度假回来，发现培养皿被霉菌污染了。但他注意到：霉菌周围的细菌都死了！这个'意外'拯救了数百万人的生命。
story_en: In 1928, Fleming returned from vacation to find his petri dishes contaminated with mold. But he noticed: bacteria around the mold had died! This 'accident' saved millions of lives.
fun_fact: 弗莱明很邋遢，实验室乱糟糟的。但正是这种'邋遢'让他发现了青霉素！有时候，混乱也能带来好运。
fun_fact_en: Fleming was messy, his lab chaotic. But this 'messiness' led to penicillin's discovery! Sometimes chaos brings good luck.
impact: 青霉素是人类发现的第一种抗生素，在二战中拯救了无数士兵的生命，被称为'20世纪最伟大的发现'。
impact_en: Penicillin was humanity's first antibiotic, saving countless soldiers' lives in WWII, called 'the greatest discovery of the 20th century'.
kid_friendly_explanation: 弗莱明发现一种霉菌能杀死细菌。这种霉菌做成的药叫青霉素，能治疗很多感染，比如肺炎、伤口感染等。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Fleming discovered a mold that kills bacteria. Medicine made from this mold is called penicillin, treating many infections like pneumonia and wound infections.

quiz.question: 弗莱明是怎么发现青霉素的？
quiz.question_en: How did Fleming discover penicillin?

title: 哈勃宇宙膨胀
description: 埃德温·哈勃发现宇宙正在膨胀
description_en: Edwin Hubble discovered the universe is expanding
story: 哈勃观测遥远星系，发现它们都在远离我们，而且越远的星系退行越快。这意味着宇宙在膨胀！
story_en: Hubble observed distant galaxies, finding they're all moving away from us, and the farther they are, the faster they recede. This means the universe is expanding!
fun_fact: 哈勃原本是个律师和篮球运动员，后来才转行做天文学家。哈勃太空望远镜就是以他的名字命名的。
fun_fact_en: Hubble was originally a lawyer and basketball player before becoming an astronomer. The Hubble Space Telescope is named after him.
impact: 宇宙膨胀的发现支持了大爆炸理论，改变了人类对宇宙起源和演化的认识。
impact_en: The discovery of cosmic expansion supported the Big Bang theory, changing humanity's understanding of the universe's origin and evolution.
kid_friendly_explanation: 想象一个气球上画了很多点，吹气球时，所有点都在互相远离。宇宙就像这个气球，一直在膨胀！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Imagine dots on a balloon—when you inflate it, all dots move apart. The universe is like this balloon, constantly expanding!

quiz.question: 哈勃发现遥远的星系在做什么？
quiz.question_en: What did Hubble discover distant galaxies are doing?

title: 核裂变发现
description: 奥托·哈恩和弗里茨·施特拉斯曼发现了核裂变现象
description_en: Otto Hahn and Fritz Strassmann discovered nuclear fission
story: 哈恩用中子轰击铀原子，发现铀原子分裂成了更小的原子，并释放出巨大能量。他的合作者莉泽·迈特纳（因为是犹太人逃到瑞典）解释了这个现象。
story_en: Hahn bombarded uranium atoms with neutrons, finding uranium split into smaller atoms, releasing enormous energy. His collaborator Lise Meitner (who fled to Sweden being Jewish) explained this phenomenon.
fun_fact: 莉泽·迈特纳对核裂变的理解做出了关键贡献，但因为性别和种族歧视，没有获得诺贝尔奖。后来元素'镆'（Meitnerium）以她的名字命名。
fun_fact_en: Lise Meitner made key contributions to understanding nuclear fission but didn't win the Nobel Prize due to gender and racial discrimination. Later, element 'Meitnerium' was named after her.
impact: 核裂变的发现导致了原子弹和核电站的出现，既带来了毁灭性武器，也提供了清洁能源。
impact_en: Nuclear fission's discovery led to atomic bombs and nuclear power plants, bringing both destructive weapons and clean energy.
kid_friendly_explanation: 核裂变就像打碎一个原子，会释放出巨大的能量。核电站就是用这个原理发电的。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Nuclear fission is like breaking an atom, releasing enormous energy. Nuclear power plants use this principle to generate electricity.

quiz.question: 核裂变会释放什么？
quiz.question_en: What does nuclear fission release?

title: 晶体管发明
description: 贝尔实验室的科学家发明了晶体管，开启了信息时代
description_en: Bell Labs scientists invented the transistor, inaugurating the information age
story: 肖克利、巴丁和布拉顿在贝尔实验室发明了晶体管，这个小小的器件可以放大电流和开关电路。它取代了笨重的真空管。
story_en: Shockley, Bardeen, and Brattain at Bell Labs invented the transistor, a tiny device that amplifies current and switches circuits. It replaced bulky vacuum tubes.
fun_fact: 第一个晶体管只有指甲盖大小，现在一个芯片上有几十亿个晶体管！你的手机里就有它们。
fun_fact_en: The first transistor was fingernail-sized; now a chip contains billions of transistors! Your phone has them.
impact: 晶体管是现代电子技术的基础，没有它就没有计算机、手机、互联网。它改变了整个世界！
impact_en: Transistors are the foundation of modern electronics; without them, no computers, phones, or internet. They changed the entire world!
kid_friendly_explanation: 晶体管就像一个超小的开关，能控制电流。把很多很多晶体管组合起来，就能做出计算机和手机！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: A transistor is like a tiny switch controlling electric current. Combining many transistors creates computers and phones!

quiz.question: 晶体管取代了什么？
quiz.question_en: What did transistors replace?

title: DNA双螺旋
description: 沃森和克里克发现了DNA的双螺旋结构
description_en: Watson and Crick discovered DNA's double helix structure
story: 沃森和克里克根据罗莎琳德·富兰克林拍摄的X射线衍射照片，推导出DNA是双螺旋结构。他们冲进酒吧宣布：'我们发现了生命的秘密！'
story_en: Watson and Crick deduced DNA's double helix structure from Rosalind Franklin's X-ray diffraction photos. They rushed into a pub announcing: 'We've discovered the secret of life!'
fun_fact: 富兰克林的X射线照片（51号照片）是关键证据，但她因为癌症早逝，没能获得诺贝尔奖。诺贝尔奖不颁给已故的人。
fun_fact_en: Franklin's X-ray photo (Photo 51) was key evidence, but she died young from cancer and didn't win the Nobel Prize. Nobel Prizes aren't awarded posthumously.
impact: DNA结构的发现是20世纪生物学最重要的成就，开启了分子生物学时代，为基因工程、医学诊断等奠定了基础。
impact_en: DNA structure's discovery was the 20th century's most important biological achievement, launching molecular biology and laying foundations for genetic engineering, medical diagnostics, and more.
kid_friendly_explanation: DNA就像一本生命说明书，记录了你所有的遗传信息。它的形状像一个扭曲的梯子（双螺旋）。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: DNA is like a life instruction manual, recording all your genetic information. Its shape is like a twisted ladder (double helix).

quiz.question: DNA的结构是什么形状？
quiz.question_en: What shape is DNA's structure?

title: 激光器发明
description: 西奥多·梅曼制造了世界上第一台激光器
description_en: Theodore Maiman built the world's first laser
story: 梅曼用红宝石制造了第一台激光器，产生了强烈的红色光束。激光是'受激辐射光放大'的缩写。
story_en: Maiman used ruby to build the first laser, producing an intense red beam. LASER stands for 'Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation'.
fun_fact: 激光刚发明时，有人说它是'寻找应用的解决方案'。现在激光无处不在：CD播放器、激光手术、激光切割、激光雷达！
fun_fact_en: When lasers were invented, someone called them 'a solution looking for a problem'. Now lasers are everywhere: CD players, laser surgery, laser cutting, LIDAR!
impact: 激光技术广泛应用于通信、医疗、工业、科研等领域，是现代科技的重要工具。
impact_en: Laser technology is widely used in communications, medicine, industry, research, and more—an essential tool of modern technology.
kid_friendly_explanation: 激光是一种特殊的光，所有光波都整整齐齐地排列，非常强大。可以用来切割金属、做手术、读取光盘！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Lasers are special light with all light waves neatly aligned, very powerful. Used to cut metal, perform surgery, read discs!

quiz.question: 第一台激光器用什么材料制成？
quiz.question_en: What material was the first laser made from?

title: 人类登月
description: 阿波罗11号成功登月，阿姆斯特朗成为第一个踏上月球的人
description_en: Apollo 11 successfully landed on the Moon, with Armstrong becoming the first person to walk on it
story: 1969年7月20日，阿姆斯特朗走下登月舱，说出了那句名言：'这是个人的一小步，却是人类的一大步。'全世界6亿人通过电视观看了这一历史时刻。
story_en: On July 20, 1969, Armstrong stepped off the lunar module, saying the famous words: 'That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind.' 600 million people worldwide watched this historic moment on TV.
fun_fact: 登月舱的计算机只有4KB内存，比你的手机弱100万倍！但它成功完成了任务。
fun_fact_en: The lunar module's computer had only 4KB of memory, a million times weaker than your phone! But it successfully completed the mission.
impact: 登月是人类探索太空的里程碑，展示了科技的力量，激励了无数人投身科学事业。
impact_en: The Moon landing was a milestone in human space exploration, demonstrating technology's power and inspiring countless people to pursue science.
kid_friendly_explanation: 人类坐着火箭飞到月球上，在月球上走路、跳跃、插旗子，还带回了月球石头！这是人类第一次离开地球去另一个星球。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Humans flew to the Moon in rockets, walked, jumped, planted flags, and brought back Moon rocks! This was humanity's first time leaving Earth for another celestial body.

quiz.question: 第一个登上月球的人是谁？
quiz.question_en: Who was the first person to walk on the Moon?

title: 互联网诞生
description: ARPANET首次连接成功，互联网的前身诞生
description_en: ARPANET's first successful connection, the Internet's predecessor was born
story: 1969年10月29日，加州大学洛杉矶分校的计算机向斯坦福大学发送了第一条消息：'LOGIN'。但只发出了'LO'，系统就崩溃了！
story_en: On October 29, 1969, UCLA's computer sent the first message to Stanford: 'LOGIN'. But only 'LO' was sent before the system crashed!
fun_fact: 互联网最初是为了军事目的设计的，目标是即使部分网络被摧毁，其他部分仍能工作。现在它连接了全世界！
fun_fact_en: The Internet was initially designed for military purposes, so that even if parts were destroyed, others would still work. Now it connects the whole world!
impact: 互联网彻底改变了人类的通信、工作、学习和生活方式，创造了一个全球互联的信息时代。
impact_en: The Internet completely transformed human communication, work, learning, and lifestyle, creating a globally connected information age.
kid_friendly_explanation: 互联网就像一张巨大的网，把全世界的计算机连接起来。你可以和地球另一端的人聊天、看视频、玩游戏！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: The Internet is like a huge web connecting computers worldwide. You can chat with people on the other side of Earth, watch videos, play games!

quiz.question: 互联网最初是为什么目的设计的？
quiz.question_en: What was the Internet initially designed for?

title: PCR技术发明
description: 凯利·穆利斯发明了聚合酶链式反应（PCR）技术
description_en: Kary Mullis invented Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) technology
story: 穆利斯在开车时突然想到：可以用酶来复制DNA片段！PCR能在几小时内把一段DNA复制成数百万份。
story_en: While driving, Mullis suddenly thought: enzymes can copy DNA fragments! PCR can replicate a DNA segment into millions of copies in hours.
fun_fact: 穆利斯是个很有个性的科学家，他喜欢冲浪，还写过自传。他因为PCR获得了诺贝尔化学奖。
fun_fact_en: Mullis was a very unique scientist who loved surfing and wrote an autobiography. He won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for PCR.
impact: PCR是分子生物学最重要的技术之一，广泛用于医学诊断、法医鉴定、考古研究。新冠检测就用的是PCR技术！
impact_en: PCR is one of molecular biology's most important techniques, widely used in medical diagnostics, forensics, archaeological research. COVID testing uses PCR technology!
kid_friendly_explanation: PCR就像一台DNA复印机，能把一小段DNA复制很多很多份，让科学家能够研究它。
kid_friendly_explanation_en: PCR is like a DNA photocopier, copying a small DNA segment many times so scientists can study it.

quiz.question: PCR技术可以做什么？
quiz.question_en: What can PCR technology do?

title: 万维网发明
title_en: Invention of the World Wide Web
description: 蒂姆·伯纳斯-李发明了万维网（WWW）
description_en: Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web (WWW)
story: 伯纳斯-李在欧洲核子研究中心工作，为了方便科学家分享信息，他发明了网页、浏览器和HTTP协议。他把这项发明免费贡献给全人类！
story_en: Berners-Lee worked at CERN and, to help scientists share information, invented web pages, browsers, and HTTP protocol. He freely gave this invention to all humanity!
fun_fact: 伯纳斯-李本可以成为亿万富翁，但他选择不申请专利。他说：'这应该属于每个人。'
fun_fact_en: Berners-Lee could have become a billionaire but chose not to patent it. He said: 'This should belong to everyone.'
impact: 万维网让互联网变得易用，创造了我们今天看到的网络世界。没有它，就没有网站、社交媒体、在线购物！
impact_en: The World Wide Web made the Internet user-friendly, creating the online world we see today. Without it, no websites, social media, or online shopping!
kid_friendly_explanation: 万维网就是你在浏览器里看到的所有网页。伯纳斯-李发明了网页、链接、浏览器，让互联网变得好用！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: The World Wide Web is all the web pages you see in browsers. Berners-Lee invented web pages, links, and browsers, making the Internet easy to use!

quiz.question: 伯纳斯-李为万维网申请专利了吗？
quiz.question_en: Did Berners-Lee patent the World Wide Web?

title: CRISPR基因编辑
description: 詹妮弗·杜德纳和埃马纽埃尔·卡彭蒂耶发现了CRISPR-Cas9基因编辑技术
description_en: Jennifer Doudna and Emmanuelle Charpentier discovered CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing technology
story: 科学家发现细菌有一套免疫系统（CRISPR），能精确地切割DNA。他们把这个系统改造成基因编辑工具，就像给DNA做'剪切-粘贴'！
story_en: Scientists discovered bacteria have an immune system (CRISPR) that precisely cuts DNA. They adapted this system into a gene editing tool, like 'cut-and-paste' for DNA!
fun_fact: CRISPR技术简单、便宜、精确，被称为'基因魔剪'。2020年，杜德纳和卡彭蒂耶获得了诺贝尔化学奖。
fun_fact_en: CRISPR technology is simple, cheap, and precise, called 'genetic scissors'. In 2020, Doudna and Charpentier won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry.
impact: CRISPR可能治愈遗传病、改良农作物、消灭疾病。但也引发了伦理争议：我们应该编辑人类基因吗？
impact_en: CRISPR could cure genetic diseases, improve crops, eliminate diseases. But it raises ethical questions: should we edit human genes?
kid_friendly_explanation: CRISPR就像一把超级精确的剪刀，能剪掉DNA上的'错误'部分，换上'正确'的。可以用来治疗疾病！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: CRISPR is like super-precise scissors, cutting out 'wrong' parts of DNA and replacing them with 'correct' parts. Can be used to treat diseases!

quiz.question: CRISPR技术最初是在哪里发现的？
quiz.question_en: Where was CRISPR technology originally discovered?

title: 引力波探测
description: LIGO首次直接探测到引力波，证实了爱因斯坦的预言
description_en: LIGO first directly detected gravitational waves, confirming Einstein's prediction
story: 2015年9月14日，LIGO探测器捕捉到了13亿光年外两个黑洞合并产生的引力波。这个信号在地球上只持续了0.2秒！
story_en: On September 14, 2015, LIGO detectors captured gravitational waves from two black holes merging 1.3 billion light-years away. The signal lasted only 0.2 seconds on Earth!
fun_fact: 引力波让空间伸缩的幅度比原子核还小1000倍！探测它就像在地球和太阳之间测量一根头发丝的宽度。
fun_fact_en: Gravitational waves stretch space by less than 1/1000th the width of an atomic nucleus! Detecting them is like measuring a hair's width between Earth and the Sun.
impact: 引力波的探测开启了观测宇宙的新窗口，让我们能'听到'宇宙的声音，研究黑洞、中子星等极端天体。
impact_en: Gravitational wave detection opened a new window to observe the universe, letting us 'hear' cosmic sounds and study black holes, neutron stars, and other extreme objects.
kid_friendly_explanation: 引力波就像时空的涟漪。当很重的东西（如黑洞）碰撞时，会在时空中产生波纹，传遍整个宇宙！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Gravitational waves are like ripples in spacetime. When very heavy objects (like black holes) collide, they create waves in spacetime that spread across the universe!

quiz.question: 引力波是什么产生的？
quiz.question_en: What produces gravitational waves?

title: 黑洞照片
description: 事件视界望远镜（EHT）拍摄了人类历史上第一张黑洞照片
description_en: Event Horizon Telescope (EHT) captured humanity's first image of a black hole
story: 全球8个射电望远镜联合观测，形成一个地球大小的虚拟望远镜。经过2年的数据处理，终于得到了M87星系中心黑洞的照片！
story_en: Eight radio telescopes worldwide observed together, forming an Earth-sized virtual telescope. After 2 years of data processing, they finally obtained an image of the black hole at M87 galaxy's center!
fun_fact: 这个黑洞距离我们5500万光年，质量是太阳的65亿倍！照片中的橙色光环是黑洞周围的热气体。
fun_fact_en: This black hole is 55 million light-years away, with a mass 6.5 billion times the Sun's! The orange ring in the image is hot gas around the black hole.
impact: 黑洞照片直接证实了黑洞的存在，验证了广义相对论，是天文学的重大突破。
impact_en: The black hole image directly confirmed black holes' existence, verified general relativity, and was a major astronomical breakthrough.
kid_friendly_explanation: 黑洞是宇宙中最神秘的东西，连光都逃不出来。科学家用超级望远镜给它拍了照片，看起来像一个发光的甜甜圈！
kid_friendly_explanation_en: Black holes are the universe's most mysterious objects—even light can't escape. Scientists used super telescopes to photograph one, looking like a glowing donut!

quiz.question: 黑洞照片中的光环是什么？
quiz.question_en: What is the ring in the black hole image?
